paragraph.paragraph:
This cluster contains all the common properties available for Vision2
/libraries/vision2/content/10_widgets/index.xml widgets and
../20_items/index.xml items . Every Vision2 widget has the same set of properties inherited from EV_WIDGET, but many widgets also inherit additional properties, further refining the behavior of the widget. To view the classes contained in the property cluster, click
/libraries/vision2/reference/interface/properties/index.xml here .

EV_WIDGET inherits the following properties:
../../reference/interface/properties/ev_pick_and_dropable_chart.xml EV_PICK_AND_DROPABLE
For an overview of the Pick and Drop mechanism, click
ev_pick_and_dropable.xml here .
../../reference/interface/properties/ev_sensitive_chart.xml EV_SENSITIVE
If a Vision2 component inherits EV_SENSITIVE, it can be made to ignore events. Use disable_sensitive to disable event handling, and enable_sensitive to restore event handling.
../../reference/interface/properties/ev_colorizable_chart.xml EV_COLORIZABLE
If a Vision2 component inherits EV_COLORIZABLE it has facilites for modifying its foreground and background colors. Use set_foreground_color to set the foreground_color and set_background_color to set the background_color. Use set_default_colors to restore the colors to their defaults.
../../reference/interface/properties/ev_help_contextable_chart.xml EV_HELP_CONTEXTABLE
If a Vision2 component inherits EV_HELP_CONTEXTABLE, facilities are provided for associating help to the component when F1 or Shift F1 is pressed.
../../reference/interface/properties/ev_positioned_chart.xml EV_POSITIONED
If a Vision2 component inherits EV_POSITIONED it is possible to query its current position, size and minimum size. Use x_position and y_position to find its position relative to its parent. Use width and height to find its size. Use minimum_width and minimum_height" to find its size.
../../reference/interface/properties/ev_containable_chart.xml EV_CONTAINABLE
If a Vision2 component inherits EV_CONTAINABLE it is able question its parent. Use parent to query the current parent.
paragraph.note: Note: EV_CONTAINABLE has no features for setting the parent. In Vision2, a child has no features for setting its parent, while a parent such as ev_container contains routines for adding children (one example is extend).
paragraph.paragraph:
The following properties are also used within Vision2:
EV_DESELECTABLE
EV_DRAWABLE
EV_FONTABLE
EV_PIXMAPABLE
EV_POSITIONABLE
EV_SELECTABLE
EV_TEXTABLE
EV_TOOLTIPABLE
